posts.cooked:
I keep getting this error, “Windows cannot find ‘C:\Program Files\National Instruments\NI Package Manager\NIPackageManager.exe’. Make sure you typed the name correctly, and then try again” when I try installing the 2025 FRC Game Tools.

Beforehand, I did some stuff without thinking about it and those were deleting the National Instruments file under “Program Files” and uninstalling the 2024 FRC Package Manager and Software.

, if y’all could, please help, much appreciated!

Thanks.

posts.name: Team 10034 Programmer
posts.cooked:
Download FRC Game Tools and find support information. You can use this download page to access FRC Game Tools and all available editions are available from this download page.

Try to download again?
I get the same error as before.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
By deleting stuff in program files without uninstalling, game tools probably thinks that the NI package manager is still installed. I suspect the fix would be to install NI Package Manager. Package Manager Download - NI

However, it’s quite possible your installation is more broken then that. If so, I suspect that NI support will be better able to help. General - NI Community

For reference, there’s instructions for properly uninstalling here: Installing the FRC Game Tools — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Installing the FRC Game Tools — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked:
So, I found a new solution:

Reinstalling Windows.

However, before reinstalling windows, it is good to save all important data before reinstalling as it will probably delete some.

I found this solution on the NI forum.

After reinstalling, I am able to get the game tools back.

Side note:

I also had to reinstall WPILIB, Github Desktop, Git Bash, Java 17, and many more. Basically everything.
